User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111104165243

Steps to reproduce:

I did a search, then saved the result as a folder with "Search Online" checked.  Then, I marked this as a "favorite folder".


Actual results:

The search result folder showed up, as expected, in my "Favorite Folders" view.

HOWEVER, when I exited and restarted Thunderbird, the search result folder did NOT show up in my "Favorite Folders" view.

The folder still had the "favorite folder" property checked.  I unchecked "favorite folder", and then checked it again, and the folder appeared in my "Favorite Folders" view.  But when I exited and restarted Thunderbird again, the search result folder did NOT show up in the "Favorite Folders" view, even though it did have the "favorite folder" property checked.

It appears that search result folders marked as favorites upon startup are NOT being included in the "Favorite Folders" view when TB 8 starts.


Expected results:

The "Favorite Folders" view ought to include search result folders that are marked as favorites upon startup.

(This is Thunderbird version 8.0, running on Windows 7.  The same thing happens with TB 8 running on Ubuntu Linux 11.04.)

comments.raw_text:
In fact, I'm seeing the same misbehaviour as that described in 707056 -- switching to a different folder view, and then switching back to "favorite folders", causes my search result folders to appear in the list of favorites.  No need to uncheck and recheck the "favorite folder" boxes on the folders -- merely changing the folder view back and forth is sufficient to make them appear in the favorites list.

For some reason, it had never occurred to me to try this before. :-)

I'll mark bug 707056 as a duplicate of this bug.

The same misbehaviour also occurs with Thunderbird 14.0, running on Ubuntu 11.04 (Natty).  Going into "View > Folders" in the menu, changing from "Favorite" to "All" -- and then going back into the menu and changing from "All" to "Favorite" -- causes my two favourite search folders to appear.

I'm updating the version for this bug to 14.  Since it appears to affect Windows 7, Mac OS X, and Linux, I'm also updating the platform to x86 / All.
